competitive_intel:
## Available Competitive Intelligence

- Competition description: `../research/description.md`
- 5 top kernel notebooks in `../research/kernels/`

data_findings.finding: Key features for survival prediction: Sex (female survival ~74%), Pclass (1st class ~63% survival), Age (children more likely to survive), Family size (FamilySingle, FamilySmall, FamilyLarge), Title extracted from Name (Mr, Mrs, Miss, Master, etc.), Fare, Embarked. Best submission score achieved: ~0.77990 with tuned voting classifier.

Stacking approach: Use 5 base models (RandomForest, ExtraTrees, AdaBoost, GradientBoosting, SVC) to generate out-of-fold predictions, then use XGBoost as second-level meta-learner. Key: uncorrelated base models produce better ensemble results. Public LB score: 0.808 (80.8% accuracy). Feature engineering: Name_length, Has_Cabin, FamilySize, IsAlone, Title extraction, Age/Fare binning.

Comprehensive feature engineering workflow: 1) Title extraction from Name (Mr, Mrs, Miss, Master, Rare), 2) Age imputation using median by Pclass/Sex, 3) Age bands (5 bins), 4) Fare bands (4 bins), 5) FamilySize = SibSp + Parch + 1, 6) IsAlone flag, 7) Drop Ticket, Cabin, Name after feature extraction. Models tested: Random Forest best on training (86.76%), followed by Decision Tree, SVM. Key correlations: Sex (female=0.74 survival), Pclass (1st=0.63), Embarked (C=0.55).

Data characteristics: 891 train samples, 418 test samples. Binary classification (Survived). Target imbalanced: 61.6% died, 38.4% survived. Missing values: Age (177/891=20%), Cabin (687/891=77%), Embarked (2). Key survival patterns: Female 74.2% vs Male 18.9%, Pclass 1: 63%, Pclass 2: 47%, Pclass 3: 24%.
